meanings.definition: The ability of an object or material to resume its original shape after being stretched or compressed.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band's elasticity allowed it to stretch and then return to its original size.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's elasticity made it easy to pull on and take off without losing its shape.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's elasticity was put to the test when it was blown up to its limit.
meanings.sent4: The trampoline's elasticity was like a spring, bouncing anyone who jumped on it.
meanings.sent5: The slingshot's elasticity was so strong that it launched the stone far into the distance.

meanings.definition: The quality of being flexible and adaptable.
meanings.sent1: Her mind's elasticity allowed her to quickly adjust to new situations.
meanings.sent2: The team's success was due to their collective elasticity in handling unexpected challenges.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes showed the elasticity of his humor, appealing to all audiences.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements had an elasticity that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The company's growth was a result of its financial elasticity in changing markets.

meanings.definition: The property of a substance that allows it to return to its original size and shape after being deformed.
meanings.sent1: The sponge's elasticity made it easy to squeeze and then watch it expand back.
meanings.sent2: The memory foam's elasticity ensured a comfortable sleep by adjusting to the body's shape.
meanings.sent3: The clay's elasticity surprised the sculptor as it bounced back to its original form.
meanings.sent4: The rubber ball's elasticity was so strong that it bounced higher than expected.
meanings.sent5: The spring's elasticity was crucial in absorbing shocks and returning to its original position.
